skeletonlisp

Class PrimitiveApplier

  • java.lang.Object
    • skeletonlisp.PrimitiveApplier

extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      • primitives

        private java.util.ArrayList<LExp> primitives
        the container for all the primitive keywords in SkeletonLisp.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PrimitiveApplier

        public PrimitiveApplier()
        The constructor initializes and sets up the ArrayList primitives.

    • Method Detail

      • lookupPrimitive

        public LExp lookupPrimitive(LId proc)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        The method lookupPrimitive() can be used to check whether a given keyword is a primitive or not.

        Parameters:
        proc - proc is the procedure of an application
        Returns:
        the procedure itself is returned if it is a primitive
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - throws an Exception if the procedure is not a primitive.

      • add1

        public LExp add1(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> paramVal)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        The method add1() (primitive ADD1) takes one pre-evaluated parameter and increments it by one.

        Parameters:
        paramVal - the list of parameters given to ADD1
        Returns:
        returns a new LNumber that equals paramVal.get(0) + 1
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if either a wrong number of parameter values is given, or the parameter Value is not a number.

      • and

        public LExp and(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> params,
       Evaluator evaluator)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        The method and() (primitive AND) takes any number of non-pre-evaluated parameters.

        Parameters:
        paramVal - the list of parameters given to AND
        evaluator - the evaluator used to evaluate the value of the parameters.
        Returns:
        returns NIL if any of the values of the parameters given is NIL. Otherwise AND returns the value of the last parameter. If no parameters are given to ANd, AND returns '#T.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if, for some reason, some parameter value cannot be evaluated.

      • atomPredicate

        public LExp atomPredicate(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> paramVal)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        The method atomPredicate() (primitive ATOM?) takes one pre-evaluated parameter.

        Parameters:
        paramVal - the list of parameters given to ATOM?
        Returns:
        returns NIL if the value of the parameter is not an atom (LATOMTYPE or LNUMBERTYPE), '#T otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if a wrong amount of parameters are given.

      • car

        public LExp car(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> paramVal)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        The method car() (primitive CAR) takes one pre-evaluated parameter.

        Parameters:
        paramVal - the list of parameters given to CAR
        Returns:
        returns the first cell of an LPair.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if either a wrong amount of parameters are given, or the given parameter is not an LPair (LPAIRTYPE).

      • cdr

        public LExp cdr(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> paramVal)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        The method cdr() (primitive CDR) takes one pre-evaluated parameter.

        Parameters:
        paramVal - the list of parameters given to CDR
        Returns:
        returns the second cell of an LPair (the 'REST' of the pair).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if either a wrong amount of parameters are given, or the given parameter is not an LPair (LPAIRTYPE).

      • cons

        public LExp cons(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> params,
        Evaluator evaluator)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        The method cons() (primitive CONS) takes two non-pre-evaluated parameters. and CONSes them into a new LPair.

        Parameters:
        paramVal - the list of parameters given to CONS
        evaluator - the evaluator used to evaluate the value of the parameters
        Returns:
        returns a new LPair where the first cell equals the first parameter value evaluated, and the second cell equals the second parameter value evaluated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if either a wrong amount of parameters are given or, for some reason, some of the given parameters cannot be evaluated.

      • defineGlobally

        public LExp defineGlobally(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> params,
                  Environment globalEnv,
                  Evaluator evaluator)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        The method defineGlobally() (primitive DEFINE) takes exactly one LId and one non-pre-evaluated parameter. It binds the LId into the value of the parameter in the globalEnv given to it.

        Parameters:
        params - the list of parameters given to DEFINE
        globalEnv - the environment in which the binding applies.
        evaluator - the evaluator used to evaluate the value of the parameters.
        Returns:
        returns the evaluated value of the second parameter given to it.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if either a wrong amount of parameters are given or the first parameter is not an LId, or if the second parameter cannot be evaluated, for some reason.

      • eqPredicate

        public LExp eqPredicate(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> paramVals)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        The method eqPredicate (primitive EQ?) takes exactly two pre-evaluated parameters and checks whether they are the same non-numeric atom.

        Parameters:
        paramVals - the list of parameters given to EQ?
        Returns:
        returns '#T if they are the same non-numeric atom, otherwise NIL is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An Exception is thrown if either a wrong amount of parameters is given, or not all of the parameters are LAtoms.

      • list

        public LExp list(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> params,
        Evaluator evaluator)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        The method list() (primitive LIST) takes any number on non-pre-evaluated parameters. It returns a new list with all the parameters evaluated in the same order that the original parameters were given to LIST.

        Parameters:
        params - the list of parameters given to LIST
        evaluator - the evaluator used to evaluate the value of the parameters.
        Returns:
        returns a new list (a pair whose cdrs are also pairs but the last cdr being NIL) of the evaluated values of the parameters.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if, for some reason, any of the parameters cannot be evaluated.

      • negativePredicate

        public LExp negativePredicate(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> paramVal)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        The method negativePredicate() (primitive NEGATIVE?) takes exactly one pre-evaluated parameter.

        Parameters:
        paramVal - the list of all the parameters given to NEGATIVE?
        Returns:
        returns '#T if the parameter is a negative number, otherwise NIL.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if either a wrong amount of parameters is given, or the parameter given is not an LNumber.

      • not

        public LExp not(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> paramVal)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        The method not() (primitive NOT) takes one pre-evaluated parameter.

        Parameters:
        paramVal - the list of parameters given to NOT
        Returns:
        returns '#T if the parameter is NIL, otherwise returns NIL.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an exception is thrown if a wrong amount of parameters is given.

      • nullPredicate

        public LExp nullPredicate(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> params)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        the method nullPredicate() (primitive NULL?) takes one pre-evaluated parameter.

        Parameters:
        params - the list of parameters given to NULL?
        Returns:
        returns true if the parameter given is NIL, otherwise returns NIL
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an Exception is thrown if a wrong amount of parameters is given.

      • numberPredicate

        public LExp numberPredicate(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> paramVal)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        The method numberPredicate() (primitive NUMBER?) takes one pre-evaluated parameter.

        Parameters:
        paramVal - the list of parameters given to NUMBER?
        Returns:
        returns '#T if the parameter given is an LNumber, otherwise NIL
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An Exception is thrown if a wrong number of parameters is given.

      • or

        public LExp or(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> params,
      Evaluator evaluator)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        The method or() (primitive OR) takes any number of non-pre-evaluated parameters

        Parameters:
        params - the list of parameters given to OR
        evaluator - the evaluator with which the parameters are evaluated
        Returns:
        true if any of the parameters' values differs from NIL, NIL otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An Exception is thrown if, for some reason, any of the parameters cannot be evaluated.

      • pairPredicate

        public LExp pairPredicate(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> paramVal)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        The method pairPredicate (primitive PAIR?) takes exactly one pre-evaluated parameter

        Parameters:
        paramVal - the list of all the parameters given to PAIR?
        Returns:
        returns true if the parameter's value is an LPair, otherwise NIL
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An Excpetion is thrown, if a wrong amount of parameters is given.

      • positivePredicate

        public LExp positivePredicate(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> paramVal)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        The method positivePredicate() (primitive POSITIVE?) takes exactly one pre-evaluated parameter

        Parameters:
        paramVal - the list of all the parameters given to POSITIVE?
        Returns:
        returns '#T if the parameter's value is a non-zero positive number, NIL otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An Exception is returned if either a wrong amount of parameters is given or the parameter given is not an LNumber.

      • sub1

        public LExp sub1(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> paramVal)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        The method sub1 (primitive SUB1) takes exactly one pre-evaluated LNumber.

        Parameters:
        paramVal - the list of all the parameters given to SUB1
        Returns:
        returns a new LNumber that equals paramVal.get(0) - 1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An Exception is thrown if either a wrong number of parameters is given, or the parameter given is not an LNumber.

      • zeroPredicate

        public LExp zeroPredicate(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> paramVal)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        The method zeroPredicate() (primitive ZERO?) takes exactly one pre-evaluated LNumber

        Parameters:
        paramVal - the list of all the parameters given to ZERO?
        Returns:
        returns '#T if the parameter's value is 0, otherwise NIL
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an Exception is thrown if either a wrong number of parameters is given, or the given parameter is not an LNumber.
